720421f-a.folder: Hester Street & Mott Street, Manhattan, NY
720421f-a.text:
172 Hester Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Mott Street.
Building concerned is a 4-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 527

721770f-a.folder: Mott Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
721770f-a.text:
Mott Street, at the N.W. corner of Hester Street. Also shown is Hester Street, west from Mott, to and including Centre Streets.
August 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

Shrine to St. Augustine at 89 Elizabeth Street during Feast in
his honor.
August 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

732230f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 1
Dr. Kung-Chuan Chi, editor-in-chief of the Chins Daily News, a Chinese language paper published in New York City. China Daily
News is located at 105 Mott Street.
1940
Alexander Alland

732230f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 1.

732231f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 2
Dr. Chi, editor-in-chief of the China Daily News, was formerly Commissioner of Education and Dean of Law at the University of
Shansi Province.
1940
Alexander Alland
732231f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 2.

732232f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 3
Constance Hong, a Columbia graduate, sometimes pinch-hits as secretary to her husband, publisher of the China Daily News.
1940
Alexander Alland
732232f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 3.

732233f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 4
Chu Hong, publisher, and Dr. Chi, editor, in the office of  the China Daily News.
1940
Alexander Alland
732233f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 4.

732234f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 5 Mr. Hong goes over a proof with Dr. Chi.
1940
Alexander Alland
732234f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 5.

732235f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series---No. 6 Mr. Moy, City Editor, has a witty column of his own in the China Daily News, titled, 'I write As I Please."
1940
Alexander Alland
732235f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 6.

732236f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily 'Sews Series--No. 7
The China Daily News, with a circulation of about 2000, receives news via a modern teletype machine.
1940
Alexander Alland

732243f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 14
The staff of the China Daily News have their meals served in
their own cooperatively run dining room.
1940
Alexander Allsnd

7-ec NNE. eP
.To set characters vertically into the forms requires great patience and skill.

732245f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series---No. 16
Rolling out a proof.
1940
Alexander Alland
732245f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 16.

732246f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 17

A Goss-Comet flat bed press spins out 2000 copies of the paper
in 20 minutes. The mail edition goes to Chinese colonies in San
Francisco, Washington, and Chicago.

1940

Alexander Alland
732246f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 17.

732247f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 18
Keeping the press in good running order is essential to news.
paper business anywhere.
1940
Alexander Alland
732247f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 18.

732248f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 19 Excited newsboys receiving their papers hot off the press.
1940
Alexander Alland
732248f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 19.

732249f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 20 Excited newsboys receiving their papers hot off the press.
1940
Alexander Alland
732249f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 20.

732250f.text:
Newspapere: China Daily News Series--No. 21 This Chinese newsboy contentedly counts his papers, calmed down with the photographer's discarded flash bulb.
1940
Alexander Alland
732250f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 21.

732251f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 22
The ancient abacus, called 'suan pon," is still used in Chinese business offices in preference to modern adding machines.
1940
Alexander Alland
732251f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 22.

732252f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 23
"Moi Hua," sturdy winter blooming tree adopted by the Chinese people as representative of the spirit of New China. This picture of "Moi Hua," by a famous Chinesspainter, Chang Hsin, who now resides in this country, can be seen in the business office of the
China Daily News.
1940
Alexander Alland
732252f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 23.

732253f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 24 Mother reads the latest news from China to her hhildren. The China Daily News also features fine short stories.
1940
Alexander Alland
732253f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 24.

732465f-a.folder: Hester Street and Mott Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
732465f-a.text:
Vendor, of soft-drinks perhaps, on Hester near Mott Street, using a
converted baby carriage for conveyance.
August 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
732465f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments.
